paper_abstract: The general Randic index R(alpha)(G) of a graph G, which is also called the connectivity index, is defined as the sum of the weights (d(u)d(v))(alpha) of all edges uv of G, where d(u) denotes the degree of a vertex a in G and a is an arbitrary real number. In this paper, we consider the set of trees with a given order and diameter, and determine the extremal trees with the maximum general Randic index for 0 < alpha < 1 among this kind of trees. The minimum general Randic index for -1 <= alpha < 0 is also considered.
paper_title: General Randic Index on Trees with a Given Order and Diameter
